intro: Memecylon pseudonigrescens, commonly known as the black-stemmed memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other economically important trees. The plant is characterized by its dark, almost black stems and opposite, ovate leaves with smooth margins. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in panicles, and it produces small, woody fruits containing a single seed. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and research settings.
